title: Probability of difference in roommate income

content.description: Sean and Evan are college roommates who have part-time jobs as servers in restaurants. The distribution of Sean’s weekly income is approximately normal with mean <math alttext="$225" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>225</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and standard deviation <math alttext="$25" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>25</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. The distribution of Evan’s weekly income is approximately normal with mean <math alttext="$240" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>240</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and standard deviation <math alttext="$15" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>$</mi> <mn>15</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>.
content.question: Assuming their weekly incomes are independent of each other, which of the following is closest to the probability that Sean will have a greater income than Evan in a randomly selected week?

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Determine parameters for probability distributions.
